      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty(@Nullable
                              Object value)
        Determines whether the specified object is null or empty.

        Will check the size of the specified object if the object is an array or a implementation of Collection or Map. Otherwise, will check the length of the string representation of the specified object.

        Parameters:
        value - an any object to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the value is null empty

      • check

        public static <T> T check(@Nullable
                          String name,
                          @Nullable
                          T value,
                          boolean checkResult,
                          @Nullable
                          String requirement)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Ensures that the specified object meets the condition.

        e.g.
        int variable = 0;
        check("foo", variable, variable == 1, "must be one"); // will throw new IllegalArgumentException("foo must be one, but it is 0.")

        Parameters:
        name - a name of the value
        value - an object to be checked
        checkResult - result of checking the condition
        requirement - requirement
        Returns:
        the value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the checkResult is false

                                 String name,
                                 @Nonnull
                                 T value)
                          throws IllegalArgumentException
        Ensures that the specified object is non-null.
        Parameters:
        name - a name of the value
        value - an object to be checked
        Returns:
        the value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the value is null

                                  @InRange(from="from",to="to")
                                  double value,
                                  @ValidNumber
                                  double from,
                                  @ValidNumber
                                  double to)
                           throws IllegalArgumentException

        to - inclusive upper limit of the range

        the value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if !isInRange(value, from, to)

      • checkInRange

        public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> T checkInRange(@Nullable
                                                               String name,
                                                               @InRange(from="from",to="to")
                                                               T value,
                                                               @Nullable
                                                               T from,
                                                               @Nullable
                                                               T to)
                                                        throws IllegalArgumentException
        Ensures that the specified value is included in the range.
        Parameters:
        name - a name of the value
        value - a value to be checked
        from - inclusive lower limit of the range (unlimited if null)
        to - inclusive upper limit of the range (unlimited if null)
        Returns:
        the value
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if !isInRange(value, from, to)
        See Also:
        isInRange(Comparable, Comparable, Comparable)

      • checkInRangeIfNonnull

        public static <T extends Comparable<? super T>> T checkInRangeIfNonnull(@Nullable
                                                                        String name,
                                                                        @Nullable @InRange(from="from",to="to")
                                                                        T value,
                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                        T from,
                                                                        @Nullable
                                                                        T to)
                                                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Ensures that the specified value is null or included in the range.
        Parameters:
        name - a name of the value
        value - a value to be checked
        from - inclusive lower limit of the range (unlimited if null)
        to - inclusive upper limit of the range (unlimited if null)
        Returns:
        the value (null if the value is null)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value != null && !isInRange(value, from, to)
        See Also:
        isInRange(Comparable, Comparable, Comparable)
